title: TWA Poster Typeface
content:
Hello, Just wondering what type face is in the logo and NEW YORK parts of this poster.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173746im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Poster_216_thumb_5249.jpg)
author: andy_ab11

comments.content: Most likely hand lettered. [Vectora](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173746/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/vectora_com_96_black_italic/&sample_text=NEW%20YORK&sample_size=60) is an option, though less heavy. Also [ITC Franklin Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173746/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_franklin_gothic_std_heavy_italic/&sample_text=NEW%20YORK&sample_size=60) or [Twentieth Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173746/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/twentieth_century_std_ultra_bold_italic/&sample_text=NEW%20YORK&sample_size=60).
